providers.description: Regional agency providing services and supports to help older adults remain independent and connected in their communities.
providers.eligibility: Adults age 60 and older and their caregivers residing in the Rappahannock Area Planning District
providers.name: Rappahannock Area Agency on Aging

providers.description: Provides adult education services including high school equivalency preparation, English language instruction, and workforce readiness programs for adults in the Fredericksburg region.
providers.eligibility: Adults 18 and older seeking adult education, GED preparation, English language learning, or workforce skills training
providers.hours: Varies by program; daytime and evening classes available
providers.name: Fredericksburg City Public Schools Adult Education

providers.description: Adult education, workforce training, and career readiness programs serving the Germanna Community College region.
providers.eligibility: Adults seeking education, workforce skills, credentials, or career advancement within the Germanna service region
providers.name: Germanna Community College Adult Education & Workforce Programs

providers.description: Provides adult education services including GED preparation, English language learning, adult basic education, and workforce readiness for the Rappahannock Area region.
providers.eligibility: Adults aged 18 and older residing in the Rappahannock Area
providers.name: Rappahannock Area Regional Adult Education

providers.description: State veterans service office providing benefits assistance, claims support, and referrals for veterans and their families.
providers.eligibility: Veterans, service members, and eligible dependents residing in the Fredericksburg region
providers.name: Virginia Department of Veterans Services - Fredericksburg Office

providers.description: Provides home-delivered meals to qualifying residents of Spotsylvania County who are unable to shop or cook independently.
providers.eligibility: Homebound residents of Spotsylvania County, generally seniors and adults with disabilities.
providers.name: Spotsylvania County Meals on Wheels

providers.description: Regional Area Agency on Aging providing services, supports, and advocacy for older adults and caregivers in Planning District 16.
providers.eligibility: Primarily adults age 60 and older and their caregivers residing in the service area
providers.name: Healthy Generations Area Agency on Aging

providers.description: Public fixed-route and commuter bus transportation serving the Fredericksburg region.
providers.eligibility: Open to the general public
providers.name: FRED Transit (Fredericksburg Regional Transit)

providers.description: Workforce development center providing employment, training, and career support services.
providers.eligibility: Job seekers and employers in the Fredericksburg regional service area
providers.name: Virginia Career Works - Fredericksburg Center

providers.address: 1001 Princess Anne St, Suite 101, Fredericksburg, VA 22401
providers.description: Provides free civil legal assistance to low-income residents, including help with housing stability, family law, domestic violence protection, and access to public benefits.
providers.eligibility: Low-income residents of the Fredericksburg region
providers.name: Legal Aid Works - Fredericksburg Office

providers.description: Voluntary home-visiting program supporting expectant parents and families with young children through parenting education, child development guidance, and family support.
providers.eligibility: Expectant parents and families with young children in the Rappahannock Area
providers.name: Healthy Families Rappahannock Area

providers.description: Early childhood education and family support services for low-income infants, toddlers, and preschool-aged children.
providers.eligibility: Income-eligible families with children ages birth to 5 within the service area
providers.name: Head Start / Early Head Start - Fredericksburg

providers.address: Multiple locations serving Fredericksburg and surrounding counties, VA
providers.description: Community-based programs focused on youth development, healthy living, and social responsibility, including childcare, education enrichment, and wellness programs.
providers.eligibility: Open to the public; some programs require membership or income-based qualification for financial assistance
providers.name: YMCA of the Virginia Peninsulas - Rappahannock Area

providers.description: Provides one-to-one youth mentoring programs that support positive youth development through professionally supported, long-term relationships.
providers.eligibility: Children and youth typically ages 6–18 in the Greater Fredericksburg area; volunteer mentors must meet screening requirements.
providers.name: Big Brothers Big Sisters Greater Fredericksburg

providers.description: Accredited Child Advocacy Center providing coordinated response, forensic interviews, advocacy, and counseling for children who are victims of abuse and their non-offending caregivers.
providers.eligibility: Children and non-offending caregivers referred by law enforcement, CPS, or partner agencies within the service region.
providers.name: Safe Harbor Child Advocacy Center

providers.description: Provides crisis intervention, advocacy, and support services for survivors of sexual violence.
providers.eligibility: Survivors of sexual assault and their non-offending family members
providers.name: Rappahannock Council Against Sexual Assault

providers.description: Regional nonprofit providing crisis intervention, emergency shelter, advocacy, and support services for survivors of domestic and sexual violence, stalking, and human trafficking.
providers.eligibility: Survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, stalking, or human trafficking in the Greater Fredericksburg region
providers.name: Empowerhouse

providers.description: Provides free medical care, specialty referrals, medications, and care coordination for uninsured and underinsured adults in the Fredericksburg region.
providers.eligibility: Uninsured or underinsured adults with limited income living in the Fredericksburg region
providers.hours: By appointment; clinic hours vary by service
providers.name: Greater Fredericksburg Medical Outreach

providers.description: Low-cost preventive dental care provided by dental hygiene students under the supervision of licensed dental professionals.
providers.eligibility: Open to the public; suitable for individuals seeking affordable preventive dental services
providers.hours: Varies by academic semester; appointments required
providers.name: Germanna Community College Dental Hygiene Clinic

providers.description: Community-based primary care clinics providing affordable medical services, often serving uninsured or underinsured patients.
providers.eligibility: Open to the community, with emphasis on uninsured and underinsured residents
providers.name: Mary Washington Healthcare Community Care Clinics

providers.description: Local public health department providing clinical services, disease prevention, environmental health, and community health programs.
providers.eligibility: Residents of the Rappahannock Area Health District service region
providers.name: Rappahannock Area Health District - Fredericksburg Health Department

providers.description: Provides free primary medical care, specialty referrals, mental health services, and medications to uninsured, low-income adults.
providers.eligibility: Uninsured adults with low income; residency in the Fredericksburg region required
providers.hours: By appointment; hours vary by service
providers.name: Moss Free Clinic (Lloyd F. Moss Free Clinic)

providers.description: Local Alcoholics Anonymous intergroup supporting recovery from alcoholism through meetings, information, and referrals.
providers.eligibility: Individuals seeking help with alcohol addiction
providers.hours: Varies by service and meeting schedule
providers.name: Alcoholics Anonymous – Fredericksburg Intergroup

providers.description: A nonprofit, peer-led fellowship providing a 12-step recovery program for individuals seeking freedom from drug addiction.
providers.eligibility: Anyone with a desire to stop using drugs
providers.hours: Meetings held daily at various times and locations
providers.name: Narcotics Anonymous – Fredericksburg Area

providers.description: Provides charitable assistance and social services including emergency aid, counseling, and immigration-related support to individuals and families in the Fredericksburg region.
providers.eligibility: Open to individuals and families in need within the Fredericksburg region; some programs have income or residency requirements.
providers.name: Catholic Charities Diocese of Arlington – Fredericksburg Office

providers.description: Nonprofit regional healthcare system providing hospital, outpatient, and specialty medical services to Central Virginia.
providers.eligibility: Open to the general public; specific services may have medical or insurance requirements
providers.hours: Varies by facility and department; hospitals operate 24/7
providers.name: Mary Washington Healthcare

providers.description: Local affiliate of the National Alliance on Mental Illness providing education, support groups, and advocacy for individuals and families affected by mental illness.
providers.eligibility: Individuals with mental illness, family members, and community members in the Rappahannock Area
providers.hours: Varies by program; support groups and classes offered on scheduled dates
providers.name: National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) Rappahannock Area

providers.description: Community-based nonprofit providing mental health education, peer support, advocacy, and suicide prevention programs in the Fredericksburg region.
providers.eligibility: Open to individuals, families, and community members in the Fredericksburg region
providers.name: Mental Health America of Fredericksburg

providers.description: Public provider of behavioral health, developmental disability, and substance use services for the Rappahannock Area.
providers.eligibility: Residents of Fredericksburg City, Spotsylvania County, Stafford County, or King George County who meet program criteria
providers.name: Rappahannock Area Community Services Board

providers.description: Faith-based outreach ministry providing food assistance and basic support to individuals and families in need in the Fredericksburg area.
providers.eligibility: Open to individuals and families in need
providers.hours: Varies by program; contact church for current schedule
providers.name: Fairview Baptist Church – Genesis Ministry

providers.description: Provides emergency utility assistance through the EnergyShare program to help households avoid electric or heating service disconnection.
providers.eligibility: Households in the Fredericksburg region experiencing a utility crisis and meeting income and program guidelines
providers.hours: Mon–Fri, business hours (call for appointment and availability)
providers.name: EnergyShare – Salvation Army (Fredericksburg)

providers.address: 1108 S. Central Park Blvd, Fredericksburg, VA 22401
providers.description: Provides emergency assistance to individuals and families in need, including limited utility bill assistance, food support, and other basic needs through parish-based volunteers.
providers.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing financial hardship within the Fredericksburg-area service region
providers.hours: Varies by parish conference; call for details
providers.name: St. Vincent de Paul Society (Fredericksburg)

providers.description: Nonprofit organization providing affordable housing support, housing counseling, and rental assistance programs for low- to moderate-income households.
providers.eligibility: Low- to moderate-income residents of Fredericksburg City and the counties of Spotsylvania, Stafford, Caroline, and King George
providers.name: Central Virginia Housing Coalition
providers.notes: Does not directly provide utility bill payment assistance; clients seeking utility help are typically referred to DSS or community action agencies.

providers.description: Provides short-term financial assistance to help eligible households pay utility bills and prevent service shutoffs.
providers.eligibility: Residents of Fredericksburg City, Stafford County, or Spotsylvania County experiencing financial hardship
providers.name: SERVE Utility Assistance

providers.description: A faith-based nonprofit providing food assistance, emergency financial help, and supportive services to individuals and families in crisis.
providers.eligibility: Residents of Fredericksburg City and surrounding counties experiencing financial or food insecurity
providers.name: Community Ministry Center of Fredericksburg

providers.address: Multiple clinic locations across the Rappahannock Area Health District
providers.description: Provides nutrition assistance, healthy food benefits, nutrition education, breastfeeding support, and health referrals for eligible women, infants, and young children through the federal WIC program.
providers.eligibility: Pregnant women, postpartum and breastfeeding women, infants, and children under age five who meet income and residency requirements
providers.hours: Clinic hours vary by location; generally Mon–Fri during business hours
providers.name: Rappahannock Area WIC (Women, Infants, and Children)

providers.description: Provides public assistance programs and social services to eligible residents of Spotsylvania County.
providers.eligibility: Residents of Spotsylvania County who meet program requirements
providers.name: Spotsylvania Department of Social Services

providers.description: Coordinates homeless services, housing assistance, and system planning for individuals and families experiencing homelessness in the Fredericksburg region.
providers.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness or at risk of losing housing in the Fredericksburg region
providers.name: Fredericksburg Region Continuum of Care
providers.notes: Operates the regional Coordinated Entry system. Call for screening and referral to shelters, transitional housing, and permanent supportive housing programs.

providers.description: Regional food bank providing food assistance through a network of partner agencies serving individuals and families facing food insecurity.
providers.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing food insecurity within the service region (accessed through partner agencies)
providers.name: Fredericksburg Regional Food Bank
providers.notes: Food is distributed through partner pantries and programs. Individuals should contact a local pantry or dial 211 for referral.
